title: john mcdonnell israel labour shamima begum
story: The revelation comes despite Labour saying ISIS teen Shamima Begum should be allowed back to Britain.Mr Corbyn said the -year-old jihadist should be given support and not have her citizenship revoked.But in , Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell suggested British citizens in the Israeli military should be at risk of having their passports stripped.He wrote to Theresa May, then the Home Secretary, and asked her to take action against UK-Israeli dual nationals.Mr McDonnell suggested they may have been implicated in war crimes related to the Israeli Defence Forces campaigns in Gaza.He said: I am aware of the Government’s policy of detaining and prosecuting those British citizens travelling to fight in the current Middle East conflicts.Will you be warning any British citizens considering engagement with the IDF that, in line with established British Government practice , such engagement may put their British citizenship in jeopardy Given the seriousness of the current situation in Gaza and the apparent escalation of the Israeli attacks on Palestinians, I urge you to address these questions promptly so that any British citizen currently participating or planning to participate in these attacks is warned of the potential consequences and thus may be deterred from acting in this way.The letter, revealed by the Guido Fawkes blog, was deleted from Mr McDonnells website some time after he became Shadow Chancellor.A Labour spokesman said: This was at the height of the barbaric bombing and attacks on Gaza when hundreds of Palestinian men, women and children were being killed.This is a simple statement of law and standard practice by the government aimed at deterring and pointing out the risks involved in British citizens joining any foreign conflict. For those holding joint citizenship it does not entail making them stateless.Yesterday Mr Corbyn sparked anger by backing Begums right toto the UK despite fleeing four years ago to join ISIS.He said: She was born in Britain, she has that right to remain in Britain and obviously a lot of questions she has to answer but also some support that she needs.The Labour boss was accused of siding with Britains enemies after his controversial intervention.

title: karl lagerfeld cremation anna wintour models fashion chanel designer
story: The Chanel designer died from pancreatic cancer aged  in Paris on Tuesday morning.Lagerfeld was cremated in Nanterre, west of Paris, after he famously quipped that hed rather die than be buried.Vogue editor Wintour joined a host of high-profile mourners, including supermodel Natalia Vodianova and Caroline de Monaco, the Princess of Hanover.Also in attendance was Virginie Viard, who has taken over as creative director at Chanel.Lagerfelds muse and model Brad Korenig also paid his respects alongside his son Hudson, .Hudson was Lagerfelds godson and is expected to be in his will and in line to inherit part of his  million fortune.Lagerfeld once said he would have no funeral because he was really against remembrances.According to Bild, he had written a manual on how the company should react to his death.The five-page document tells shop staff to locally purchase a large, white flower bouquet existing out of white roses, to place in the middle of thewindow.He specied that the flowers must have cm long stems and should be placed in transparent or basic white vases.Staff are also told to responded to messages of condolences by saying Thank you for your condolences or It is a hard time for all of us.A spokesman for Chanel has said his wishes will be respected and there would be a private ceremony.Lagerfelds health had been failing for several weeks before he died and there was widespread concern when he did not appear at the end of the recent Chanel Show in Paris.He was dubbed the Kaiser of Fashion for presiding over iconic fashion house Chanel for more than  years.The superstar designer produced as many as eight collections a year to the joy of fashion editors, fans and collectors.Lagerfeld was born into a wealthy German family in Hamburg on September , , moving to Paris in  to follow his dream of a career in fashion.In later le he claimed he fell in love with the fashion industry when his mum took him to a Dior show in .He quickly made a name for himself but made his biggest career move in  when Chanel made him creative director.He is credited with making the label more modern and appealing to a younger audience with a range of exciting new colours, modied cuts and other fabrics.Over the years, Lagerfeld’s own signature look also became iconic – a black suit with his white hair pushed into a ponytail, fingerless gloves and dark glasses.His mother, Elizabeth, was a lingerie saleswoman while his father, Otto, was a businessman, and both encouraged him to pursue his love of clothes.He was hired as the personal assistant to legendary French fashion designer Pierre Balmain while in his early s, and then produced his first haute couture collection in the late s.It was in the s that international superstars such as the English actress Elizabeth Taylor began wearing his work.Other massive fans have included Madonna, Kylie Minogue and Royals including the late Princess Diana.

title: independent group mps rule out deal with lib dems and say they aim to run the country
story: Ex-Labour MP Chris Leslie said that while the new ‘Independent Group’ would work with parties on certain issues, they were “creating something dferent” to the current political system.And in a dismissive swipe at the Lib Dems run by Vince Cable, he told The Sun: “They do have this issue of trust hanging over their history.“I don’t think we should let the existing parties continue to carve up the country.”The comments came as ex-Tory Heidi Allen revealed the staggering ambition of Britain’s newest political force.Speaking two days after defecting from the Conservatives, she said the so-called TIG want “ultimately to be in Government”.Ms Allen quit the Tories with Anna Soubry and Sarah Wollaston to merge with eight Labour MPs led by Chuka Umunna and Mr Leslie.Mr Umunna earlier this week said they expect to register as a political party later this year.Other defections from Labour are expected this weekend.One Labour source said: “Have no doubt, Chuka Umunna wants to be Prime Minister, and he wants to field candidates in all  seats at the next Election.”Vince Cable called for a “partnership” with the Independent Group both in Westminster and across the country.He said it wouldn’t make sense to be “at each other’s throats” and they shouldn’t field candidates against each other.But Mr Leslie said any kind of partnership went against the idea of the “new force” the Independent Group was trying to create.And he signalled the Lib Dems should themselves leave their current political party and cross to his ownthey wanted to team up.He said: “What’s important for us is that we are trying to create something dferent to the th century institutions work.“I mean no disrespect to the [Lib Dems], they have their own organisation and there will always be a Liberal party.“But everyone has to make a sacrice here. If there’s a sense they don’t need to do anything signicant like we have, I don’t think that’s right.”Speaking to her local paper – the Cambridge Independent - Heidi Allen claimed the country was “desperate for a new moderate, centre ground party”.She added: “The response has been unbelievable. title: meghan markle royal family reputation princess diana private secretary
story: The Duchess of Sussex, , jetted into New York this week to have a baby shower with friends and indulge in some shopping.The trip reportedly cost around £, but because it was a private visit the British taxpayer didn’t pick up the tab.Friends of Meghan are said to have paid the bill but the Duchess came under fire from some just for making the journey.And Princess Diana’s former private secretary Patrick Jephson has issued a word of caution saying flashy jaunts risk the “credibility and dignity” of the “royal free-riders”.He said: She is a prominent member of the British Royal Family, entrusted with the country’s reputation in everything she does.That responsibility sometimes seems at odds with her personal behaviour.Mr Jephson wrote in the Daily Mail: From any angle, the look of Meghan’s Manhattan partying is pretty unedying.Not just for its excess — though that’s impressively unsettling — but for its calculated recklessness.Mr Jephson, who was Diana’s equerry and private secretary between  and , said the former actress has a serious decision to make.He said: “It’s a stark choice between the path of celebrity versus the path of duty, service and sacrice.”Meghan used a a Gulfstream G twin jet plane, which is believed to have cost £, for the six-hour journey back to the UK from the Big Apple.She stayed in a swanky Manhattan hotel’s £,-a-night penthouse following her star-studded baby shower.Amal Clooney, Suits star Abigail Spencer and stylist Jessica Mulroney were all snapped leaving the hotel in a snow shower.Tennis star Serena Williams and human rights lawyer Amal Clooney were said to be co-hosting the event for the Penthouse Suite.Williams is reportedly footing the £, bill for extravagant shower.Meghan, along with husband Prince Harry, , are now off to Morocco for a three-day visit promoting diplomatic relations and showing support for charitable causes.

title: alesha macphail mum forever haunted last photo
story: Georgina Lochrane - who has shared this precious last photo of the murdered six-year-old - said she appeared “terried and scared” when she identied her naked body.The harrowing ordeal left the mum of two sobbing beside cops, who had asked her to confirm a corpse found in woods was her eldest.Georgina, , told The Scottish Sun: “I looked at her and it was asit wasn’t my little girl lying there.“That was a scared, terried little girl. I could just see it.I just broke down in tears. No parent should have to go through this — to have your child murdered.”Alesha’s killing brought her family’s world crashing down last summer.The last photo of her with Alesha was taken just  hours before she headed off to stay with her dad Robert, , and his parents in Rothesay, Bute.Georgina said: “We posed for a snap together on the day before she went away. It was our last ever picture together.“I’ll treasure it for ever — it’s so precious to me.”Georgina, of Airdrie, said she has endured mental and physical trauma and continues to suffer nightmares.She attended all nine days of the murder trial at the High Court in Glasgow — a case described by judge Lord Matthews as “one of the most evil in the history of this court”.She had to step outside when horric details of the killing were revealed.But she saw justice served when Aaron Campbell, , was convicted of abduction, rape and murder on July .The teens identity was protected due to his age, but he was finally unmasked as a cat-torturing monster who was obsessed with horror ghoul Slender Man.Georgina — who gave birth to Alesha when she was the same age as the fiend — said: “We hope he rots in jail and never sees the light of day again.“We wanted him to be named and shamed so the whole world would know who the evil monster was.”Alesha was tucked up in bed when boozed-up Campbell crept into her dads house at am armed with a kne.He snatched the youngster, subjected her to a savage sexual attack and smothered her - then was caught on CCTV casually ing home for a shower.Shattered Georgina revealed how she had a mothers instinct something was wrong - and woke up consumed by an inexplicable ache for the six-year-old hours before she learned she was missing.And she was horried to read online tributes from strangers as police launched a search.She told the Scottish Sun: “I called the police and my lawyer asking why these people were saying that my child was dead. I was hysterical and I was told two police officers were on their way.“Usually you see on the TV programmes two police officers chapping the door to break the bad news — but I had to call them up myself. It’s just not meant to happen like that.“When they arrived and said a body had been found, my legs gave way and I fell to the ground.She hailed her “most amazing child” and added: “Alesha could talk the back legs off a donkey.“She had the most infectious laugh and she would stop and chat to everyone.“If she didn’t get what she wanted she would always say, ‘Why ’ She would question everything. We were so alike.”Devoted Georgina — also mum to Courtney, four — now hopes to keep Alesha’s memory alive by setting up an organisation in her name.She added: “I plan at some point to open a charity in respect of Alesha and it will be all voluntary based.“My children have always been my world. I’ve been a stay-at-home mum since I was . My career path could wait. I wanted to raise my children then deal with my wants and needs. I always put them first.“Now I need to continue doing that for Courtney while keeping Alesha’s memory alive.“I want the world to know and remember my beautul wee girl.”Georgina last year told of the special bond she enjoyed with Alesha, who was four weeks premature.She said the tot “changed her le for the better” and gave her the “best six-and-a-half years of her le”.Georgina said: “I never knew what love was until I laid my eyes on the most loving, caring, beautul girl.“Alesha was so smiley and bubbly. She was smart and could be a drama queen just like any wee girl.“I miss everything about her. I just can’t believe she’s never coming home.“Her little sister talks about her every day.“The day Alesha went to stay with her dad, they were cuddling on the couch saying they loved each other. That’s a memory I will never forget.”Georgina pledged to “forget the hurt and pain” on what would have been Alesha’s seventh birthday last October .She joined friends and family for a special bubble and balloons party at her girl’s graveside in Coatbridge.She said at the time: “I want people to remember her how she was — and to forget about the hurt and pain. She always wanted a bubble party. She may not be here to celebrate, but we’ll make it asshe was never gone.”Describing the heartbreaking celebration, she added: “This is the first birthday I haven’t spent with her.“Today was supposed to be the best day of my le — and hers. But this is the hardest day I’ll face without her.”

title: brits bask 19c sunshine uk hotter greece
story: The Met Office previously said the weekends heatwave could come near the record for the warmest February day of all time.The current record was set in  when .C was clocked in Greenwich, east London.But forecasters believe the current spring-like spell of sun could carry on setting records after Scotlands warmest ever day was recorded on Thursday, with a high of .C in Aberdeenshire.Now the Met Office forecasts a sunny, warm weekend with temperatures staying around the -C mark climbing to the high teens by mid-week.And it will be hotter than Greece this weekend, where rain and snow are currently falling and a high of just C is expected in Athens today.The current balmy weather is being caused by tropical air blown , miles over to Britain from the Caribbean.And Monday is due to beat the .C February  record, with official records stretching back to .Although more sun is on the way, some southern areas awoke to a yellow weather warning for fog this morning.The thick low-hanging cloud shrouded the capital causing flight disruption at multiple London airports.But as the fog lted, a bright day has pushed in after — and the sun is set to continue on Sunday.Temperatures are expected to stay in the mid-to-high teens tomorrow for most places in the UK.

title: brexit delay tory cabinet ministers amber rudd david gauke greg clark
story: In a joint statement, Greg Clark, Amber Rudd and David Gauke issue a thinly veiled signal that they will side with backbench rebels next week to stop Britain tumbling out without a deal on March .The Business Secretary, Work and Pensions Secretary and Justice Secretary make it clear they would defy No to vote to extend Article  exit talks.That would see Britain stay in the EU for several more months under a deal can be struck.The bombshell move - ahead of a ‘high noon’ showdown in the Commons next week - is a major challenge to the PM’s authority.But allies of the three ministers insisted it is designed to help Mrs May in her titanic battle with Tory arch-Eurosceptic group, the ERG.To stave off their rebellion, the three senior ministers also want the PM to promise to extend Article  herself.The three Cabinet heavyweights said: “It is time that many of our Conservative party colleagues in the ERG recognise that Parliament will stop a disastrous no deal Brexit on March .“If that happens, they will have no one to blame but themselves for delaying Brexit.”Justice Secretary David Gauke also told The Sun: “We want to deliver a deal so that Britain can leave the EU on March .“But time is running out, and those determined to vote against a deal that the PM wants to bring back are running the risk of a delay in Brexit.”A bid for Parliament to seize control of Brexit and delay it was voted down four weeks ago by a majority of .Just  Tory ministers or MPs need to switch sides for the attempt to hijack power from No to win when it is pushed to a vote again on Wednesday.The vote on Wednesday next week poses the biggest crisis for Theresa May’s premiership since the disastrous general election result in .She will ask the Commons for permission to continue talks with Brussels for legally binding changes to the Irish backstop to ensure it is only temporary.In their statement – delivered via an article for the Daily Mail - the threesome also warn a No Deal Brexit could threaten the United Kingdom itself, by giving the SNP a fresh opportunity to enforce a second referendum for Scottish independence.The Cabinet ministers added: “It does not take much of a leap of imagination to see how the Scots Nationalists would seek to seize the chance to break up Great Britain”.The Sun understands that No was shown a copy of the article, but not given any opportunity to stop it.If ERG hardliners do defeat the Government, then Ms Rudd, Mr Clarke and Mr Gauke want Mrs May to step in and promise to abide by an open vote in Parliament by mid-March for a Brexit delay.A source close to the Cabinet ministers said: “They hope it won’t be necessary.“Butit is, ministers will vote for the Cooper-Letwin amendment on Wednesday to give it a clear majority, and those ministers will include Greg, David and Amber.“The Prime Minister can stop them from having to do that by agreeing to extend Article  herselfthe Commons asks for it.”The source added: “At some point, she is going to have to take on the ERG, it’s that simple”.But as tensions spiralled ahead of next week’s showdown, some Tory MP Brexiteers threatened to “end the government”Mrs May requests an extension to Article .One MP from the ERG told the Financial Times: “If she said she’d extend Article , there’d be -plus MPs who would just take their bat and ball home: no domestic legislation, no Brexit legislation, they just wouldn’t be showing up any more”.Moderate Tory MPs from the -strong Brexit Delivery Group also pledged to join the rebellion against No Deal.Its leader, senior Tory backbencher Andrew Percy, told The Sun that “three dozen” of its members would now back Cooper-Letwin amendment.And he urged his “fellow Brexiteers” to wake up.He told The Sun: “There’s  of them in a bunker, surrounded by  people outside, encircled by them. They are not getting to get what they want. They have to wake up and smell the coffee.“They have to start living in the real world. The only way we can get out is to back the PM’s deal – with a legal change or a change to the backstop.“They are playing into the hands of Remainers in Parliament who are trying to stitch this up and stop Brexit from happening.”Robert Buckland became the latest Tory minister to say he is also prepared to by defy the party whip next week to vote for the Cooper-Letwin amendment to delay Brexit without a deal.Risking the sack, the Solicitor General told BBC Radio ’s Any Questions: “I’ll do whatever it takes to stop No Deal. Nobody voted for a crash out.“No self respecting Tory Government should ever deliberately inflict an act of self harm on the people we represent.”In another fresh blow for the PM, the DUP said it was also going cold again on her watered down backstop changes – with the Ulster unionists’ Brexit spokesman Sammy Wilson saying their support for her next week “at the moment doesn’t look very likely”. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: easter holiday ban brexit laws prep
story: Sources believe the PM will have to scrap at least half of the two-week Easter recess that begins on April Brexit is delayed beyond March  because of the huge amount of legislation still required to implement our EU departure.One senior government insider said: “I can see that happening”.The move is likely to spark fresh fury after February’s recess was cancelled.More than  MPs defied the announcement and went on holiday anyway.Separately, unions representing workers in Parliament said they expect Easter recess to be cancelled and have demanded clarity from the Government.The PM is expected to be forced into a short extension of Article she secures a deal. In addition to six crucial laws, she is running out of time to pass the Withdrawal Agreement Bill that implements her deal before March .But these would need to be passed in the weeks between April and July - leaving the Easter recess under threat.Separate sources said this made it inevitable that MPs could even be asked to sit over the two May bank holidays and the Whitsun recess at the end of May.Some believe Mrs May will only bring back her deal to the Commons after the summit of EU leaders on March  and  in a bid to make it a binary choice between her deal and no deal.But she could also be forced into delaying Brexita rebel amendment is backed by MPs next week, which would extend the process indefinitely.This would make the need to cancel the Easter recess less likely.Unions representing workers in Parliament demanded immediate reassurances from the Government that staff won’t be forced to cancel more of their annual leave in order to house the estate during Easter.Prospect deputy general Secretary Garry Graham said: “Staff in parliament make our democracyand they need time off like everyone .“We are seeking assurances from the government that staff will not be subject to further cancellation of leave over the Easter break.“At the very least,leave is to be cancelled then the government must be up front, it must give adequate notice, and workers must be suitably compensated.“Furthermore, we cannot be in the situation again where staff are expected to work while MPs are allowed to do whatever they please.” Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: donald tusk agree uk extending brexit talks theresa may avoid no deal
story: In the strongest signal from Brussels yet that it will grant an Article  extension, the EU Council President said “there is always the possibility of dragging the negotiations over in time”.Leaving the EU a few months later would be better than “orce without agreement which would be expensive for everyone — above all for London, but also for the other  partners”, Mr Tusk argued.His declaration came as it was also revealed the EU powerbroker will meet the PM for Brexit talks tomorrow.The pair will speak in the margins of the Sharm El-Sheikh summit of EU and Arab leaders.Mr Tusk also claimed his controversial attack on the leaders of the EU referendum’s Leave campaign was a “deliberate exaggeration”.The former Polish Premier said there was a “special place in hell” for the Brexiteers who had called for Britain’s EU exit without a plan.Mr Tusk told Polish news channel TVN: “My words were strong, but I deliberately used this exaggeration to get the attention of those who are really responsible for the fact that now all of us on both sides of the English Channel live in suspense when it comes to Brexit.“Those who promoted Brexit, they did not in fact believe in their victory, so did not prepare themselves in the slightest degree for this victory.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: alesha macphails little sister asks for her every day but struggles to understand where her older sibling has gone
story: Courtney, four, visits her murdered sibling’s grave, where she’s buried with her gran — but struggles to comprehend where the schoolgirl has gone.Georgina, , said: “Courtney is finding it very dficult. She doesn’t understand what has happened.“All she knows is her sister went to sleep and never woke up again.“She’s always asking for Alesha every day. We haven’t had the heart to tell her she is in the ground because she wouldn’t understand.“She thinks Alesha’s in the sky.”Georgina, who released balloons in her daughter’s memory, said she’s started taking Courtney to Coltswood Cemetery in Coatbridge as it’s a place they can “think about our darling girl Alesha”.We revealed the identity of Alesha’s evil killer Aaron Campbell after a judge ruled to remove his right to anonymity.Under Scots law a convicted criminal cannot be identied until they turn .But such was the severity of the crime, a judge has today ruled that the evil killer can be unmasked.Little Alesha, six, was staying with her dad and grandparents on the Isle of Bute when Campbell snatched her from her bed last July.The schoolgirl suffered catastrophic sexual injuries after being raped and strangled by the maniac.The chilling moment Campbell ed home from raping and murdering the schoolgirl was caught on his mum’s CCTV.Alesha’s great-grandad George Lochrane said the brute deserved the death penalty as he welcomed the ruling to reveal the killer’s identity.

story: NewsDog owner fined £, for letting pooch poo in garden - and not clearing it upCraig Wood, , was hauled in front of magistrates after ignoring warnings from the council about the dog messShareCommentsByEmilia Bruce-Watt:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsNeighbours complained about the stench coming from his garden "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA dog owner has been forced to pay a pound, fine after refusing to clear up dog poo in his own garden. Neighbours of Craig Wood, from Benfleet in Essex, complained to Castle Point Borough Council last summer after the foul stench of dog poo in his garden became too much. Wood was served an abatement notice by the council - which ordered him to clear the poo and ensure any mess did not build up in the future. However Wood ignored the notice - and he was slapped with a pound, fine for the breaches at Basildon Magistrates Court this week. It is understood that Wood - who lives in a block of flats - allowed the dog to foul in his own private garden, despite neighbours complaining about the smell. Despite the fine, the dog mess can still be seen in the garden.   One nearby resident, who asked not to be named, said: I dont live in the block, so have not dealt with it directly, but I have been told and I think a few neighbours were getting frustrated. It cant be nice to see, and we all know dog mess stinks, so youd be very annoyedyou could constantly smell it. Fair play to the council for taking action against him, hopefully it is a bit of a warning to others.  A spokesman for Castle Point council said: Castle Point Borough Councils Environmental Health Service has successfully prosecuted a resident on five counts of breaching an abatement notice served under the Environmental Protection Act . Mr Wood was fined a total of pound, for the breaches, ordered to pay a victim surcharge of pound and full costs of pound,. were awarded to the council.

title: independent group not what you
story: NewsopinionThe Independent Group is not what you think it isIts not a party, its not centrist and its not the solutionShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsopinion"Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIn a shared nightmare no-one can wake up from, the idea of some centrist peace and quiet is appealing. Thats why The Independent Group is polling in third place just  days after it launched. For those fundamentalists who insist dreamland is the best place to stay, its also appealing to blame the TIGgers for an impending lack of unicorns. But TIG is not the answer to our problems. Oh, its great for providing an escape route to all those who like to complain but have no idea what to do. If youre a Corbynista, Brexit headbanger or raging anti-Semite, the appearance of traitors proves all your conspiracy theories true: it was definitely THEIR fault. And for the average voter - the one whos seen a referendum turn to dust while sleep-deprived toddlers bitchslap each other around Westminster like a kindergarten whose teacher has just stepped outside for three years - it looks a lot like the grown-ups have arrived, offering a coherent, mature, alternative to extremist chaos. Its indisputable TIGs appearance was an attention-grabbing thwack of the Parliamentary blackboard. Unfortunately, its  members have not got a Scooby Doo what to do next. They have told the class to shut up and listen. But they dont know what to say.  If you look at the voting records of its members, TIG agrees wholeheartedly with itself that Britain needed austerity as well as spending. It wants to tax the rich more and less, and wants gays to have both more and fewer rights. It wants more private healthcare and to protect the NHS, to lower and raise welfare benefits, and it simultaneously supports and rejects university tuition fees, mass surveillance, and immigration controls. Its only centristyou add all that up and ide it by the Lib Dems. There are just two topics its members seem to agree on - Remaining, and the smoking ban. Thats not enough common ground to stand on for more than  minutes, never mind a -year Parliamentary term. If their unity couldnt survive a conversation in the pub, what can they achieve  Last month a string of crunch votes on Brexit produced majorities of between just  and  votes. The Brady Amendment which threw Theresa May a leline passed with just , putting our  TIGgers in a strong position to sway Brexit. If they combine with the  Lib Dems and  Scots nationalists - never mind potentially hundreds of dissenters in the main parties - they might command a majority to bring down Brexit, the government, or both. So its a damned shame theyve said they wont.  Well, *they* havent - one of the TIGgers, Gavin Shuker, has said he would prop up the government infor a soft Brexit and second referendum. And theres the problem writ large: theyre independent of each other, as well. They have chosen not to pay the pound Electoral Commission fee to register a new party. Theyve instead rented a room above a Spoons and paid pound to register at Companies House as a limited company, which doesnt exactly look like theyre aiming for Downing Street. Chuka Umunna, who is closest to being the leader the TIGgers dont have, says British politics is broken and urged those from other parties to join them. But when put on the spot hes been unable to name a single current Labour policy he disagrees with, or clearly explain what, exactly, TIG wants. The defection press conferences were aimed not at the electorate but their parties - the equivalent of hurling abuse over your shoulder before slamming the door on your way out. None of it, so far, has included an idea about a better or dferent party.  That hasnt stopped anyone referring to the non-party as a party. It hasnt stopped % of the electorate deciding to vote for the non-electable non-party with no policies. Not knowing quite what they stand for hasnt stopped their enemies decrying what they stand for. And the fact they cant agree on how to deal with % of our problems hasnt stopped any of us hoping they can, nevertheless, fix them. They are the first MPs to recognise and reflect the fact that most British people want Labours economic policies - tax the rich, spend on services, regulate the banks - AND a Tory brake on social change - immigration controls, crime crackdowns, and let Shamima Begum rot . The will of the people is clear, and utterly incomprehensible. So you can hardly blame TIG for incoherent babbling, because the rest of us are frankly no better. Chuka calls them a movement, but it doesnt move us any further on and has yet to find the messiah it needs to drive any meaningful change. Instead, the TIGgers have each picked an enemy of reason - Brexit, anti-Semitism, entryism, tribal politics, Jacob Rees-Mogg - and vowed to smash it.  Any tiger with a spring in its tail would get publicity and public support but  of them, winding up the racists and safe-spacers alike, can expect exactly the degree of hero-worship theyre getting. Thats why theyre not a party. And its why they dont want by-elections. Their aim is not to be a government-in-waiting, but to break the extremist grip which is choking the le out of both main parties. It is worth noting that  by-elections would force these MPs to absent themselves from Parliament at just the point that they could wreak the most havoc on Brexit and those shouting loudest for by-elections are very Brexity. But when May and Corbyns puppeteers have their strings cut, Brexit is delayed or trashed and were looking for new leaders in the wasteland on the other side of March , what is right, and what will be left  TIG is not the answer. It is posing a question those on all sides know must be asked - where do we go next   The TIGgers do not know. They just like to bounce - bounce the voters out of despair, the main parties out of entrail-gnawing complacency. They have no plan for what to do next, because one TIGger couldnt agree with himself, never mind  more. They are not your great, centrist, hope. They are  wrecking balls, hoping to clear the decks for something . That something has yet to manest, and the thing that will decide whether it is populist or popular will depend largely what sort of messiah we get. The first of those two options that gets a charismatic and inspiring leader will be the one to turn our heads. Remember: TIGgers dont roar. Enjoy the bouncing, and lets just hope that when the king of the jungle turns up, its Mufasa and not Scar.

title: alesha macphail everything know smirking
story: NewsAlesha MacPhail: Everything we know about smirking child killer Aaron CampbellCampbell, , was finally unmasked as Aleshas killer today, seven months after abducting, raping and murdering the six-year-old on the Isle of Bute, ScotlandShareCommentsBySophie Evans:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video aaron-campbell-made-youtube-video-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:,],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTeen Aaron Campbell was today unmasked as Alesha MacPhails killer - seven months after he abducted, raped and murdered the six-year-old. Campbell, , snatched little Alesha from her bed as she visited her dad and grandparents on the Isle of Bute, Scotland, in July last year. He brutally attacked and raped the ft ins youngster before dumping her body in woodland on the scenic and sparsely populated island. Smiley Alesha, who loved watching Peppa Pig and baking cakes, was later found facedown and naked by a member of the public. She had  separate injuries - including catastrophic ones. Campbell, who lived on the island, was yesterday found guilty of her abduction, rape and murder by jurors at Glasgows High Court. And this afternoon, he could be identied for the first time after a judge allowed his name and images of him to be published. Lting a ban on identying the boy, Judge Lord Matthews said: I cant think of a case in recent times that has attracted such revulsion. But who is Campbell and what is his background  Below, we reveal everything we know so far about the monster.  What did Campbell do  Campbell abducted, raped and murdered Alesha, who was staying at the home her dad shared with her grandparents on Bute. The little girl, who was on a three-week summer break, had been put to bed with a Peppa Pig DVD on the night of July , . But the next morning, she was found to have vanished. The High Court later heard Campbell had snatched the girl from the bed where she was sleeping, before inflicting horric injuries on her. He then dumped her body in a woodland area on the island. Alesha was reported missing from her bed at .am on July , with Police Scotland launching a large-scale search to find her. At around am, her naked body was devastatingly found on the grounds of the islands former Kyles Hydropathic Hotel.  A post-mortem found she died from pressure to neck and face. Within days of Aleshas death, Campbell had been arrested and charged. During his trial, the court heard graphic details of Aleshas injuries, with a pathologist saying: Its extremely dficult to give an accurate time of death. When askedthe injuries observed were something he had witnessed before in his years of forensic experience, Dr John Williams replied: No. Yesterday, Lord Matthews told Campbell he had committed some of the wickedest, most evil crimes the High Court had ever heard. Who is Campbell  Campbell was a -year-old cannabis smoker, living on Bute. He had moved to the island with his family as a child, and lived with his mum, dad and younger sister in a traditional stone-built home. He had been born on the mainland, but his family had brought him to the island believing it would give him a secure upbringing. His mum told the Daily Mail: I wanted him to grow up in a safe place, a peaceful environment, and get a good education.  She added that her very normal son was doing an engineering course one day a week and had plans to go to university. Known to pals as a harmless joker with a dark sense of humour, Campbell had started regularly buying cannabis at the age of . He would drink at weekends with friends and had a girlfriend, who is reported to be standing by him despite his brutal crime. He also liked to practice parkour, which involves moving rapidly through areas and jumping from buildings, the Daily Record reports. And he was a fitness fan who enjoyed boxing and lting weights. A video of Campbell, posted on his YouTube channel the year before Aleshas murder, shows him doing carefree flips on a trampoline. He brags he recently went from doing front flip s to front flip .  Had he shown signs of violence  Campbells mum has said he wasnt a violent boy. But reports have claimed he was a “serial killercaught on his first murder” who was obsessed with the horror character Slender Man. He is alleged to have been obsessed with gore and violence. A police source told The Sun: “Slender Man searches were found and it chilled seasoned investigators to the bone. Some of the circumstances between what this character does and what happened to Alesha were carbon copies.” The teenager was filmed playing violent video games, and officers found evidence he had searched online for the Slender Man. In one clip, he can reportedly be heard shouting stab and shank. In another, he yells: That is Slender Man right there.” Slender Man is a fictional character that began le as an Internet meme before growing into something much darker.  He has long arms, which he uses to prey on children, and is portrayed as a black and white image on the periphery of photos. Campbell is also alleged to have nearly drowned a dferent young girl at a leisure centre pool years before Aleshas murder. He was just six or seven when he held the youngsters head under the water for so long she feared she would drown, Bute locals claimed. And the killer is said to have slaughtered and skinned cats in his younger teens, apparently burying two feline corpses in his garden. One neighbour also claimed Campbell had become a local nuisance on Bute and was once caught trying to set fire to buildings. None of the stories, including the near-drowning, have been corroborated, but they have been making the rounds on the island. However, his mum insisted to the Mail: He wasn’t a violent boy. He smoked cannabis, but it’s re among kids on this island.  What did Campbell tell pals  After Alesha vanished, Campbell chipped in with speculation and rumours about what may have happened on a Snapchat group chat. He even sent a video of himself to pals on the group and said: Found the guy whos done it - something a friend thought was a bad joke. The teenager also sent friends a chilling Facebook message saying he might kill one day for the letime experience, his trial heard. The court was told he exchanged messages about killing with a pal. The female friend asked him the chances of getting away with murder with a good plan, to which he said: Wellit was a gd plan then %. She later messaged: Im glad Im not at the top of your hit list. In response, he was alleged to have said: No one is. The witness agreed these were theoretical exchanges where she brought up the subject of murder and at the time caused her no concern. She said they both had a dark sense of humour. And she agreed the conversation was not serious and just rubbish.  What did Campbell claim about the murder  After police were led to Campbell by his own mum, the monster told ious lies about what he did on the night Alesha vanished. Sickeningly, he even tried to blame Mr MacPhails innocent partner, Toni McLachlan, for the crime and claimed hed had an affair with her. On his trials first day, he lodged a special defence of incrimination, naming Ms McLachlan as the person responsible for the killing. However, jurors heard DNA matching Campbell was pretty well all over Aleshas body and clothes, and he had told police a pack of lies. Giving evidence in court himself, the teenager told the jury hed never do something like that in reference to the attack last summer. He claimed that he never met Alesha MacPhail in person. Askedhe brutalised the girl, he said: Its not me, absolutely not. I would never do something like that.  But when jurors were out of the courtroom, he is said to have been spotted smirking. The teenager, described as an adrenaline junkie, also told the court he and Ms McLachlan had met up and had sex early on July . He claimed he did not want to tell police this as he feared it would get back to Mr MacPhail and he would hurt Ms McLachlan. But addressing the jury on Wednesday, advocate depute Iain McSporran QC, prosecuting, said the teenager was telling a pack of lies then [to the police] and a pack of lies in the witness box. During his closing speech, Mr McSporran put it to jurors that they had heard no evidence implicating Ms McLachlan in the crime but a mountain of evidence linking the accused to it. He also said a claim by Campbell - that Ms McLachlan had taken the condom the two allegedly used on July , gone back to the house where she had been staying with her partner, Alesha and the girls grandparents, abducted the schoolgirl, carried her to the woods, smothered her to death and then planted the accuseds semen inside her - was a preposterous story. However, the teenagers defence lawyer, Brian McConnachie QC, urged the jury to acquit his client, questioning why he would abduct, rape and murder the youngster having never met her in his le.  What was he convicted of  Yesterday, justice was finally served as Campbell was unanimously convicted of abduction, rape and murder by jurors. Another charge against him - defeating the ends of justice - had been dropped by the prosecution on the eighth day of proceedings. The killer - who now faces le behind bars - had denied all charges. Aleshas loved ones broke down in tears as the verdict was ed. Campbell will be sentenced next month. Why couldnt Campbell be identied  During his nine-day trial for Aleshas murder, the teenager could not be identied for legal reasons because he is aged under . But he can now be identied after the judge lted the court order following an application from the media, including Reach Plc. The judge said: I intend to grant the application. The press may name the accused and publish images of him.

title: alesha macphails mum wore locket
story: NewsAlesha MacPhail’s mum wore locket so daughter could see killer found guiltyGeorgina Lochrane wore a pendant with a photo of her daughter Alesha MacPhail throughout the murder trial, but hid it so evil killer Aaron Campbell couldnt see the girls faceShareByChris kitching:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video cctv-shows-killer-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAlesha MacPhail’s devastated mum wore a heart-shaped locket with her daughters photo every day in court so the little girl could see her killer nailed, it is reported. The six-year-old was abducted, raped and murdered by -year-old Aaron Campbell while she was visiting her grandparents with her father on the Isle of Bute last year. Aleshas mum, Georgina Lochrane, has said she drew strength from the locket she wore around her neck during the nine-day murder trial which culminated with Campbell being found guilty of the heinous crime. Ms Lochrane, , kept the pendant tucked under her blouse in court so evil Campbell - said to have been an avid video gamer and cannabis user obsessed with fictional child abductor the Slender Man - could not set eyes on her daughter.   She told the Scottish Sun: “I never take it off. She’s my le. “I kept it hidden in court because I didn’t want that monster seeing her face ever again. “It has given me the strength to be there every single day to allow her to see justice be served. “The only way she could see that being done was through my eyes.”   Ms Lochrane said she promised her late daughter she would get justice and is happy that she got it. After the killer was named on Friday, Ms Lochrane, who was in court to hear the judges decision, posted a Facebook photo showing smiling Alesha with blue angel wings spread behind her. The happy schoolgirl appeared walking on the clouds above a purple sunset. Campbell, who lived on the same road as Aleshas grandparents, was unmasked after a judge lted a ban on revealing his identity.   A court has heard that the teenage killer has a price on his head. The girl, who lived with her mother and was from Airdrie, North Lanarkshire, was abducted from her bed, raped and murdered on July  last year on the Isle of Bute in Scotland. Her body was found dumped in nearby woodland with more than  injuries. Campbell was a fth year Rothesay Academy pupil, who lted weights, played computer games and had his own YouTube channel.   YouTube clips featuring the -year-old show him performing somersaults on a trampoline, saying to the camera: Id like to welcome you guys to the channel. In another he addresses viewers: Yo, its Aaron Campbell here. A nine-day trial at the High Court in Glasgow heard Campbell drank alcohol, used cannabis, and hosted a party of around  friends at the home he shared with his housekeeper mother earlier on the night he abducted Alesha. CCTV footage from his mothers own security system provided the evidence detectives needed to prove he had left the property on Ardbeg Road in Rothesay at the crucial time.  His mother had contacted police herself, hoping the footage would eliminate her son from the investigation. Campbell was captured coming and going from his home several times in the early hours of July , removing items of clothing and retrieving a torch. He had earlier tried to contact Aleshas father Robert MacPhail and his partner Toni McLachlan, thought to have been seeking to buy cannabis as he had done from Mr MacPhail in the past. Dr Mark Grfiths, a leading psychologist, told the Mirror that violent gaming may have been one of a number of factors in the abduction, rape and murder of Alesha. story: NewsAmber Peats stepdad plans to make documentary to prove hes a victimDanny Peat said in an interview that the only way to clear his name is to make a documentary after hes been branded an evil stepdadShareByDanya BazaraaNews Reporter:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsAmber Peat, , from Mansfield "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe stepfather of Amber Peat plans to make a documentary to prove to the world he is blameless in the -year-olds death. Ambers stepdad Danny Peat told an inquest into her death that she lied when she claimed he subjected her to humiliating punishments in the family home. And in an interview with The Sun - the first since Ambers death - he astonishingly said he has started filming a three-part documentary to put on TV or social media to set the record straight. He claimed he had been branded an evil stepfather and the most hated man in Mansfield, reportedly saying he has become a victim in the case. Amber was found hanged on June , , three days after leaving her home in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire She had stormed out of her home after being ordered to clean out a cool box, her inquest has been told.  Speaking to The Sun, Mr Peat said: Because of what people have made up, the finger has always been pointed at me as the evil stepdad who virtually marched Amber out of the house and let her die. It’s disgusting the way I have been portrayed in all this. The documentary is the only way I have to clear my name.  During the inquest, the court has heard allegations Amber was ‘heavily sanctioned’ for ‘undesirable behaviour’ – including being told to wash every pot in the kitchen and being woken at .pm and forced to mop the floors. Ambers stepdad told the inquest that the schoolgirl lied when she claimed he subjected her to humiliating punishments at home. Mr Peat claimed she had made up accounts of the incidents, which were made to teachers at her school – and said he never even ‘raised his voice’ to her. He told the hearing: “I do not like using the word, but yes she did lie.”  Mr Peat, , said the only punishments Amber faced in the home was being asked to wash the pots and having her tablet computer taken off her. While being quizzed by Amber’s biological dad, Adrian Cook – who was allowed to ask questions as an ‘interested party’ in the proceedings - he claimed: “I didn’t think itwas a massive thing. Obviously kids have to have some sort of discipline in place.” Mr Peat now says he wants to get his side of the story out there which he claims he hasnt been able to do, even while giving evidence during the inquest.  He said he will not make anything out of the documentary as he would not want to profit out of Ambers death. Eleven opportunities to save her were missed by social services and other agencies, a coroner found. Laurinda Bower, who recorded a narrative verdict and ruled out suicide, said it is “possible” Amber Peat’s le would not have ended on May , ,she’d received better help. An inquest at Nottingham Coroners Court has heard how Kelly Peat, Ambers mother, waited eight hours before reporting her daughter missing. It is thought by that stage Amber had already died.

title: beauty blogger who cakes face
story: NewsBeauty blogger who cakes face to hide acne bravely shares make-up free selfiesOffice worker Kara Eden, , who posted the images on Instagram, believes her skin issues began around three years ago when she stopped taking the contraceptive pillShareCommentsByErin Cardf:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news weird-news video blogger-self-conscious-cystic-acne-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A beauty blogger so embarrassed by her cystic acne that she would “cake” herself in make-up has bravely shared au naturel Instagram selfies to reveal her spots.Kara Eden, , believes her skin issues began around three years ago when she stopped taking the contraceptive pill - at first thinking it was a phase and the spots would heal on their own.But the office worker, from Manchester, realised it was cystic acne - the most severe form of the condition which causes large pus-filled pimples.Her confidence was shattered and she would apply full make-up every time she left the house, evenshe was just heading out to the local shop.   In late , after suffering for around  months, Kara ditched her heavy foundation and courageously shared slap-free photos on Instagram, attracting praise and thousands of followers. Kara said: “It is scary to put myself out there, hitting that send button is a big thing. “I used to edit all my photos, but then I stopped and thought, ‘No, you’re putting this out there for a reason – to show your real skin. “On Instagram especially, everything is so flawless and filtered that I knew there was a gap that needed to be filled for people to embrace their insecurities.”   Growing up, Kara never had any problems with her skin. But all that changed around three years ago, when she stopped taking the contraceptive pill. She said: “I believe it was down to the imbalanced hormones in my body. I went to the doctor, and was placed on a dferent type of pill, but all that did was mask my symptoms. “As soon as I stopped taking it, my skin flared up again, even worse than before.”  At first, Kara thought her skin would settle back down once her body adjusted to the hormonal changes. But after around three months, there were no signs of improvement and so she ed to the doctor and was given antibiotics, which had little effect. So, taking to the internet, she began to read up about cystic acne, and became convinced it was what she had. “It was a real knock, confidence-wise,” she said. “I wouldn’t even leave the house without make-up on. I’d cake it on evenI was just popping to the shop. I’d even wear it in the gym, which, looking back, I know is ridiculous.  “Thankfully, nobody ever said anything nasty, but I would get stared at, and I could tell what people were thinking.” Though she initially attempted to treat her acne with topical medication, Kara decided in  to opt for a more natural approach instead. After taking an intolerance test she ordered online, she realised she had been unknowingly eating things that were making her skin worse. So, she overhauled her diet, eliminating dairy and gluten, and cutting right down on sugar.  “At first, I didn’t see an immediate effect, so it was hard to stick to,” she said. “But after around six weeks, my skin started to improve, and so that spurred me on.” Also introducing supplements and vitamins to her daily regime, Kara, who only uses natural, organic products as harsh chemicals can have an adverse affect on her skin, ditched medication for good. Keen to use her experiences to help others, she has set up an Instagram where she shares tips and advice, as well as candid photos of her airbrush-free skin. She explained: “I am also a trained make-up artist, so wanted to start a beauty blog, but give it my own inidual spin so started posting a lot about my skin, and DIY healing.  “The more I shared, the more messages I got, mainly from others in the acne community wanting to knowsomething I was trying had worked. “Now, I have a really loyal following – we’re more like a group of friends.” By speaking out, Kara, who hailed her boyfriend of three years for supporting her, hopes to encourage others to embrace their insecurities and see past the filtered, edited world of Instagram. And, while she admits that she still feels nervous about uploading her bare-faced selfies, she said that banning herself from editing her perceived imperfections has helped her to accept them.  “The only way to build confidence is be true to yourself. If you carry on hiding away or editing a part of yourself, you’ll never accept it,” she said. “I upload my photos for all those people who don’t have the confidence, or feel they can’t among all those flawless Instagram pictures. “I still have peaks and troughs with my skin, but I have learnt not to compare myself to other people.” Speaking of the link between acne and the contraceptive pill, Dr Zenon Andreou, GP at Zava, Europe’s largest online doctor, said: The combined contraceptive pill is sometimes prescribed as a way of treating and controlling acne, as it can stabilise fluctuating hormone levels which can lead to skin inflammation, spots and in some cases, acne. Coming off the combined contraceptive pill can cause changes to your skin and its not uncommon for women to experience an acne flare up. If your skin hasn’t settled down after a month or two of coming off the pill, orthe flare up is extensive, speak to your doctor to find an alternative acne treatment. It’s worth noting that the progesterone only pills and the contraceptive implants can sometimes worsen acne, so do consider this when looking at contraceptive options.

story: NewsopinionBritains richest man could end homelessness - instead hes moving abroadJim Ratclfe is moving to Monaco - this perfectly legal operation will cost the Treasury at least £million, cash that would end the scandal of people living on the streetsShareCommentsByPaul Routledge:,  FEB NewsopinionThe homeless suffer in our cities while Jim Ratclfe has raced to move his assets offshore "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThis is a tale of two shyBritains,  style, lost in the vicious clamour over Brexit. In our towns and cities, rough sleepers fight for the best shop doorways to spend the night, while the stinking rich are jumping ship. Sir Jim Ratclfe, the country’s richest man, worth an estimated poundbillion, is moving to Monaco with enormous amounts of tax-free money. It has been reported that accountants worked for months on a “labyrinthine” plan for the billionaire boss and two fellow executives of Ineos chemicals to avoid paying a vast sum in taxes by moving their money offshore. This perfectly legal operation will cost the Treasury at least poundmillion, cash that would end the scandal of people living on the streets overnight. Brexiteer Sir Jim’s sickening scheme came to light as new figures show that the number of homeless people admitted to hospital has more than trebled in six years to ,.   The figure for those who die there after being rescued from doorway degradation has risen by % to . Admissions for pneumonia, respiratory diseases, hepatitis C and kidney disease are now up almost five-fold. The street is a lethal place, as I found investigating this story in Nottingham recently, where the homeless wrapped themselves in dirty blankets to ward off sub-zero temperatures. They all have a dferent story to tell: mental health issues, drugs, alcohol abuse, eviction, losing a partner or becoming unemployed. But they share the same fate – homeless in one of the world’s richest countries.   Sir Jim’s current big concern is how to persuade the Government to relax its Earth-tremor regulations on fracking so Ineos can pump more millions into his wallet. For the homeless, it’s how to stay in one piece. Rough sleepers are  times more likely to be a victim of violence, and twice as likely to die from infections. The average age of death for a homeless person is . Sir Jim is , looking forward to a long le of luxury on the tax-free Riviera. The homeless don’t pay tax, only fines for begging under the  Vagrancy Act, introduced for soldiers ing from the Napoleonic Wars. It does not apply to the new Napoleon of Monaco, who does not wish to comment.

title: horror woman dangles window held
story: NewsHorror as woman dangles from window held by her hair before plunging to deathShocked eyewitnesses watched from the street in Royston, Glasgow, as -year-old Alem Shimeni plummeted ft to the ground after desperately trying to claw her way back inShareCommentsByMark McGivern:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsA witness who lives in an adjacent block took this photograph and captured Alem Shimenis last moments "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThis is the horric moment a woman dangles from an th floor window ledge before plunging to her death. Shocked eyewitnesses watched from the street and nearby flats as Alem Shimeni struggled desperately to claw her way back into the flat. But she plummeted ft to the ground, dying instantly. Minutes later, locals in Glasgow’s Royston apprehended a man as he tried to flee. A witness who lives in an adjacent block took the photograph that captured the -year-old Eritrean’s last moments.He told the Daily Record : “I could hear hysterical screaming and I went to the window and I saw the woman being held by the hair.“She didn’t fall right away, because she was trying desperately to hold on to the window sill and she was scratching at the wall with her feet, trying to get a hold to keep herself from falling. “I thought I should take a photo as evidence but I was really hoping she would be dragged back in by whoever was holding her hair. “As I watched, she fell to the ground. She didn’t move. “I can’t see how anyone could have survived that. It was terrible to watch.”   Alem’s tragic death prompted calls last night from Labour MP Paul Sweeney, who represents the area, for a major overhaul of support services for immigrants - many of whom are housed in the city’s tower blocks. He said: “I am continually shocked at the hostility and vindictiveness that the most vulnerable people in the world are treated with when they come to this country. “The system is broken and leaves people even more vulnerable.” The eyewitness who took the photo told how he helped to tackle a man as he tried to run away from the scene in Charles Street. He said: “I went running down the stairs, phoning  as I went. “An African guy had come out of block  and had tried to run away. But he fell over a wall and he got grabbed by a concierge and a few women who were there. “He broke away and I ran across and grabbed him and I was helped by a few people. We held him until the police arrived a few minutes later. “There were some women there who were hysterical. They spoke the same language as the guy. “He was chanting and, I think, praying, and he looked out of it. “I have no ideahe was related to the woman in any way or what any of it was about.”   Alem fell to her death on Monday at about .pm. Worshippers at the local Eritrean Orthodox church have paid tribute to the member of their congregation, calling her a “wonderful” woman. Joseph Ghebreyesus, who is on the church board, said: “She was part of the choir. We’ve lost a wonderful person and it’s a very hard time for us.” The church is hoping to make arrangements to send Alem’s body back to her family in Eritrea. Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward but said no charges had been brought in relation to the incident. Detective Inspector Aileen Boyle, of the Major Investigation Team, said: “Officers are continuing to gather every detail possible on Alem’s death. “This is a very busy area and I am sure that there are people who may have witnessed this incident who have not yet come forward to police. “The details they hold could be vital to this investigation and I would urge anyone with information to contact us as soon as possible.” Additional police patrols have been put in place in the area and there’s an incident caravan at the foot of the tower block.

story: NewsJihadi Jack celebrated Paris terror attack - and now wants to come home to UKJack Letts, the British man dubbed Jihadi Jack, says he felt the November  attack that killed  people was justied - and he misses his mum, pasties and Doctor WhoShareByHayley CoyleChris kitching:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video isis-bride-shamima-begum-pleads-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA British man known as Jihadi Jack admits he welcomed the  Paris terror attack as a good thing while he was living in war-torn Syria. Muslim convert Jack Letts, , said he felt the ISIS gun and bomb attack, which killed  people, was justied due to the Western coalitions air strikes in Syria and Iraq. Oxford-born Letts is currently in a Kurdish prison in Syria after the Peoples Protection Units militiacharged him with being a member of the terror group. He travelled to Syria in  after dropping out of school aged , and now says he misses pasties, Dr Who and his mum - and he wants toto the UK.  In an interview with ITV News, Letts said he saw children die in coalition bombing raids while he was living in Raqqa, a former ISIS stronghold, and that left him welcoming the Paris attack in November . He said: To be honest at the time I thought it was a good thing. Genuinely, at the time, we had this idea that when youre living in Raqqa getting bombed every five minutes by coalition jets and you see literally, Ive seen children burnt alive. He said of the victims who were murdered at the Bataclan concert hall: At the time, you have this sort of - and this is what war does to you - you have this idea of why shouldnt it happen to them   But then I realised, they have nothing to do with it. Letts, who holds dual nationality through his Canadian father John Letts and his British mum Sally Lane, said he wants toto Britain, but he doubts the UK will move to bring him back. He said he hasnt spoken to his parents in two years and he doesnt think officials from Britain or Canada will help him. His parents are facing trial in the UK for allegedly funding terrorism by sending him money. But the couple deny the charge and insist their son went to Syria to help refugees.  Letts said the Red Cross has delivered censored letters from his family and they were his only contact to Britain. He told how he travelled to Syria five years ago, first learning Arabic in Jordan before moving on to Kuwait and Iraq. He claimed he lived on the Oxford Street of Raqqa - the de facto capital of the terrorist state - and married an Iraqi woman who has given birth to his son. But he said he has never seen his son and he doesnt know where his we is. Letts, who was arrested on his way to Turkey from Syria, said he misses his mother even though it may sound “toddlerish”.  He also told how he misses pasties and Doctor Who even though it sounds a bit stupid. Asked about Letts situation, a Home Office spokesperson said: In recent days the Home Secretary has clearly stated that his priority is the safety and security of Britain and the people who live here. In order to protect this country, he has the power to deprive someone of their British citizenship where it would not render them stateless. We do not comment on inidual cases, but any decisions to deprive iniduals of their citizenship are based on all available evidence and not taken lightly.  Earlier this month, ISIS bride Shamima Begum, , spoke to reporters from a Kurdish-controlled camp in Syria, saying she wanted toto the UK with her newborn baby. She left Bethnal Green in east London aged , along with two other schoolgirls, to join ISIS self-proclaimed caliphate in Syria in . Britain has revoked her citizenship and her family have written to the Home Secretary asking for his help to bring her days-old son to Britain. The letter to Sajid Javid said the baby boy was a true innocent who should not lose the privilege of being raised in the safety of this country.

title: mum smiles final selfie hours
story: NewsMum smiles in final selfie hours before she died on last day of family skiing tripDental nurse Samantha Abbots was on a family skiing trip in Morzine, France, when she died suddenly from a blood clotShareCommentsByRuby Davies:,  FEB News "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA fit and healthy mum of three posed for a smiling selfie with her family just hours before she suddenly collapsed an died while on a skiing holiday in France. Samantha Abbots, , was enjoying the final day of a family skiing trip in Morzine with her husband, Kevin, and -year-old son, Josh when disaster struck. The dental nurse went to use a restaurant toilet, while her family waited outside. Initially Kevin and Josh were not concerned when Samantha did notfrom the loo- assuming she had just got chatting to someone. However the pair heard a commotion and rushed into the restaurant where they saw Samantha lying on the floor, while a Dutch doctor carried out CPR.  Despite desperate attempts to save her le, the mum-of-three was pronounced dead at the scene, Stoke on Trent Live reports.Heartbroken Kevin said Samantha had a blood clot that started in her legs then travelled to her lungs - causing her to collapse. He said: It was the last day of our holiday. Wed spent the day skiing from am. In the morning we skied over to Switzerland and came back into France. We had stopped off at a restaurant and just before we set off again Sam went to the loo and collapsed unconcious. I didnt see it happen because we were sat outside. Shed been gone about  minutes, but the way Sam is shed always be talking to someone so I just thought she had got chatting. We first noticed something was wrong when the lady behind the bar was running around. Thats when the Dutch doctors came over and started helping. It went on for about an hour. Me and Josh stayed nearby and initially they said it was a heart attack and that they were flying paramedics in by helicopter. A local doctor from the hospital arrived and they had a chat and he made the decision to stop CPR. She had a blood clot from her legs that had gone to her lungs. They said she wouldnt of felt anything, just a bit of breathlessness then she just collapsed. Josh was very quiet after it happened, he was very close with his mum, and he still needs a hug every now and then. Hes gone back to school now with his mates and Im hoping thats going to help him.   Kevin and Samantha were just -years-old when they met each other at school in Cheshire, and they later got together when they were . The pair got engaged when they were  and were married for  years. Kevin added: We were in the same class together and got engaged at . Its just devastating. It was completely out of the blue. Its still a massive shock and we cant believe it. She had a really big passion for skiing and we had already spoken that morning about where we were going to go next. She had a brilliant time and wed gone everywhere she wanted to go to. It was one of the best skiing holidays wed had. She was active and was always walking the dog. She was a member of Kidsgrove Ski Centre and she could never keep still. She loved going to the Stoke games, she was a big Stoke City fan. She used to take the boys to the matches. She was always smiling, always happy. She would talk to anybody and was just so full of le. She was my best friend. The couples older children Brendan, , and James, , were both at home when they were told over the phone by their dad that their mum had passed away. James said: I last saw my mum on the Friday before they left. I was at my girlfriends house when I got the phone call from my dad. I then went to stay with my grandparents. It was hard not being there with them. Mum could speak to anybody. If someone was in a mood she always knew how to make the atmosphere better. I just feel like theres a big part of me missing. We always used to do stupid dances in the kitchen. She was always getting me out of trouble and I was really close with her. She was the centre of the whole family.
